subject: Gardening
title: Roses and Garlic
description: Learn Roses and Garlic in one minute.

hook.text: For centuries, gardeners have planted garlic under roses. The science behind it is surprisingly solid.

buildup.text: Garlic releases sulfur compounds into the soil and air. These compounds are antifungal and pest-repellent.

discovery.text: Research shows garlic's sulfur compounds reduce aphid populations and may suppress black spot fungus on roses.

twist.text: Garlic doesn't compete with roses for spaceâ€”it's low-growing and occupies soil the roses don't use.

climax.text: The garlic-rose pairing combines pest control, disease suppression, and spatial efficiencyâ€”a triple benefit.

punchline.text: Garlic is a rose's bodyguard disguised as a bulb.

quiz.question: What triple benefit does garlic provide to roses?
options: Faster growth, deeper color, and longer bloom time
Pest control, disease suppression, and spatial efficiency
Better fragrance, stronger stems, and winter hardiness
